presidents.name: George Washington
presidents.description: The first president of the United States and one of the Founding Fathers. He set many precedents for the future presidency.

presidents.name: Abraham Lincoln
presidents.description: The 16th president of the United States, known for leading the country through the Civil War and issuing the Emancipation Proclamation.

presidents.name: Theodore Roosevelt
presidents.description: The 26th president, known for his progressive policies, trust-busting, and the creation of national parks.

presidents.name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
presidents.vice_president: John Nance Garner, Henry A. Wallace, Harry S. Truman
presidents.description: The 32nd president, he led the United States through the Great Depression and most of World War II, and is the only president to serve four terms.

presidents.name: John F. Kennedy
presidents.description: The 35th president, known for his handling of the Cuban Missile Crisis and advocating for civil rights, his presidency was tragically cut short by assassination.

presidents.name: Ronald Reagan
presidents.description: The 40th president, a former actor and governor, known for his conservative policies, economic reforms, and the ending of the Cold War.

presidents.name: Barack Obama
presidents.description: The 44th president, and the first African American to hold the office, known for his healthcare reforms and navigating the country through the aftermath of the 2008 financial crisis.
